gurmukhi: ieh BwNiq ibjY kip kI BeI hxXo Asur rwvx qxw ]
transliteration: Eh Bhaant(i) Bijai Kap(i) Kibhaihanyo Asur Raavan Tanaa||
translation: Somewhere the ghosts are shouting violently and somewhere the Bhairavas are laughing.

gurmukhi: BY d`g Ad`g B`gy hTI gih gih kr dwNqn qiRxw ]374]
transliteration: Bhai Dagg Adagg Bhagge Hathigad(i) Gad(i) Kar Daantan Trinaa||374||
translation: In this way there was victory of Angad and he killed Akampan, the son of Ravana. On his death the frightened demons fled with the blades of grass in their mouths.374.

gurmukhi: auqY dUq rwvxY jwie hq bIr suxwXo ]
transliteration: Outai Doot Raavanai Jaae Hat Beer Sounaayo||
translation: On that side the messengers gave the news of the death of Akampan to Ravana,

gurmukhi: ieq kippq Aru rwmdUq AMgdih pTwXo ]
transliteration: Ik Kapipat At(u) Raamdoot Anadah(i) Pathaayo||
translation: And on this side Angand the lord of monkeys was sent as envoy of Ram to Ravna.

gurmukhi: khI k`Q iqh s`Q g`Q kir q`Q sunwXo ]
transliteration: Kahikatth Tih Satth Gadth Kar(i) Tatth Sounaayo||
translation: He was sent to tell all the facts to Ravna;

gurmukhi: imlhu dyhu jwnkI kwl nwqr quih AwXo ]
transliteration: Milauh Dehu Jaanakikaal Naatar Tuh(i) Aayo||
translation: And also advise him to return Sita in order to stall his death.

gurmukhi: pg Byt clq BXo bwl suq piRst pwn rGubr Dry ]
transliteration: Pag Bhet Chalat Bhyo Baal Sout Prist Paan Raghoubar Ddare||
translation: Angad, the son of Bali, went on his errand after touching the feet of Ram,

gurmukhi: Br AMk pulkq n spijXo BwNq Aink AwisK kry ]375]
transliteration: Bhar Ank Pulkat Na Sapjiyo Bhaant Anik Aasikh Dare||375||
translation: Who bade him farewell by patting on his back and expressing many types of benedictions.375.

gurmukhi: dyh sIAw dskMD Cwih nhI dyKn pYho ]
transliteration: Deh Seeaa Daskandh Chhaad(i) Nahidekhan Paiho||
translation: Angad says, “O ten-headed Ravana ! Return Sita, you will not be able to see her shadow (i.e. you will be killed).

gurmukhi: lMk CIn lIjIAY lMk liK jIq n jYho ]
transliteration: Lank Chheen Leejeeai Lank Lakh(i) Jeet Na Jaiho||
translation: Ravana says, “None can conquer me ever after the seixure of Lanka.”

gurmukhi: kRuD ibKY ijn Goru ip`K ks ju`Du mcY hY ]
transliteration: Kruddh Bikhai Jin Ghor(u) Pikkh Kas Juddh(u) Machai Hai||
translation: Angad says again, “Your intellect has been spoiled by your rage, how will you be able to wage the war.”

gurmukhi: rwm sihq kip ktk Awj miRg sXwr KvYhY ]
transliteration: Raam Sahit Kap(i) Kotak Aaj Mrig Syaar Khavai-hai||
translation: Ravana replies, “I shall cause even today all the army of monkeys alongwith Ram to be devoured by the animals and jackals.”
